text: Ipomoea hederifolia is a species of herbaceous annual vine native to the Americas. It was first described by Linnaeus in 1759. It is commonly known as scarlet morning glory, scarlet creeper, star ipomoea, trompillo or "ivy-leaved morning glory" (which otherwise refers to I. hederacea). ==References== ==External links== hederifolia Category:Plants described in 1759 Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Ipomoea hederifolia
